response_parsed.title: Type-Checking ETL Jobs Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to leverage FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs, to type-check ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) jobs in Python 3.12+. By incorporating type hints and using FastAPI's powerful features, you can enhance the reliability and readability of your ETL scripts.
key_points: Understanding the importance of type-checking for maintainable and reliable ETL jobs
Incorporating type hints in Python 3.12+ to improve code readability and type safety
Utilizing FastAPI's Pydantic models for data validation and serialization
Creating custom validators and pre-processors to handle complex business logic
Implementing testing strategies for verifying the correctness of ETL jobs

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException

app = FastAPI()

class ItemIn(BaseModel):
    name: str
    price: float

def etl():
    items_list = [...] # Example ETL job that fetches data from a source
    items = [ItemIn(name=item['name'], price=float(item['price'])) for item in items_list]
    return items

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use the updated type hints and Pydantic features
FastAPI version 0.74.0 or higher is recommended
caveats: While FastAPI provides a robust framework for building APIs, it may not be suitable for all ETL use cases, especially when dealing with large datasets
Custom validators and pre-processors can become complex and difficult to maintain as the number of business rules grows
